column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=JR :
#Text=I do n't know if I have a most treasured , but I have a most precious possession .
#Text=Shall I go get it ?
#Text=DS : Yeah , definitely .
#Text=JR :
#Text=This is a scraper .
#Text=A red chert scraper that I found walking along in the desert in New Mexico , about a year and a half ago .
#Text=Christmas , two years ago .
#Text=With two kids I work really hard -- pretty much constantly .
#Text=But the thing about this is it has such an amazing energy , to hold it .
#Text=DS : Mmm .
#Text=I feel that , yeah .
#Text=JR :
#Text=And the other -- it may be prehistoric , it may be several thousand years old --
#Text=DS : What makes it a scraper ?
#Text=JR :
#Text=This is what 's interesting , to me -- after you killed the meat , this is what you would use to scrape the inside of the flesh off the fur .
#Text=Scraping the fat or the gristle off the top of the meat .
#Text=And it 's a reminder how much harder things were , you know ?
#Text=Any time I 'm feeling down on myself --
#Text=DS : You could be scraping meat off bones .
#Text=JR : I could be scraping -- and it was really like that , you know ?
#Text=So -- there 's that .
#Text=DS : I have treasured possessions , but I also have treasured memories .
#Text=I found a suicide in the woods when I was thirteen :
#Text=a kid my age , who was probably fourteen .
#Text=It 's a treasured memory in some ways , one that ’s lasted my whole life , and it 's come back in a lot of ways .
#Text=On my MySpace profile , I make an allusion to that in my narrative .
#Text=I do n't think people actually read that .
#Text=I think that people look at pictures , and then they move on .
#Text=But that 's not really true .
#Text=I have been contacted by both that individual 's younger sister , who was eight when he killed himself , and the girlfriend he killed himself over .
#Text=Separately .
#Text=JR : Yeah , people do read the stuff on there .
#Text=People do .
#Text=On raising children
#Text=JR : The kids have made me a better writer .
#Text=DS : Really ?
#Text=JR : Yeah , on the Shakespeare thing , I think part of what was holding me back from finishing it was -- because I had written the first half in 2003 -- that I had n't had kids .
#Text=I did n't understand the characters who had children .
#Text=I did n't really understand them .
#Text=And once I had had kids , I could approach them differently .
#Text=And it 's great when kids appear in your work .
#Text=DS : Gives it depth and also maybe opens you up to a new audience .
#Text=JR : Yeah , I ca n't believe I did n't have any kids in my books .
#Text=I did have kids in my first novel , but not having kids or parents in your work is so weird .
#Text=It 's just such a weird lack .
#Text=You often see literary books that do n't have them .
